value.title: Why Political Advertisers Can’t Afford Unverified Reach In 2026
value.content:
Political advertising has always evolved alongside media consumption. But the shift from linear television to streaming has introduced challenges that campaign managers are still working to navigate. While connected TV (CTV) promises precision and flexibility, the reality facing political advertisers today is far more complex and less standardized. As dollars move from traditional TV to […]
The post Why Political Advertisers Can’t Afford Unverified Reach In 2026 appeared first on AdExchanger.

value.title: The Big Story: Live From CES 2026
value.content:
Agents, streamers and robots, oh my! Live from the C-Space campus at the Aria Casino in Las Vegas, our team breaks down the most interesting ad tech trends we saw at CES this year.

value.title: Ad Tech Doesn’t Just Have A Transparency Problem. It Has A Courage Problem
value.content:
What type of leadership and attitude do we need to innovate in digital advertising and ad tech?  We work in a highly polarized industry where our methods of tackling fraud and providing transparency are shaped by conflicting and self-interested business models. And the industry leaders who loudly and publicly advocate for their interests seem to […]
The post Ad Tech Doesn’t Just Have A Transparency Problem. It Has A Courage Problem appeared first on AdExchanger.

value.title: Who Would Grab The Live Wire?; AI, AI Everywhere
value.content:
Off Ramp Publicis signed a deal to license LiveRamp’s RampID and Authenticated Traffic Solutions (its alternative IDs to third-party cookies) on behalf of clients. This alone is hardly major news. After all, LiveRamp sells its cookieless identity products to all the major holdcos.  But Ad Age also reports that Publicis execs were “exploring” the idea […]
The post Who Would Grab The Live Wire?; AI, AI Everywhere appeared first on AdExchanger.

value.title: Amazon Ads Shares Interactive Video Best Practices At CES 2026
value.content:
Interactive video ads make more of an impact than you might expect, according to new research by Amazon Ads and Publicis Media. But when it comes to interactivity, “Simplicity is key,” said Maggie Zhang, head of global video measurement GTM at Amazon Ads, during a chat with AdExchanger at CES 2026. Viewers overwhelmingly prefer straightforward […]
The post Amazon Ads Shares Interactive Video Best Practices At CES 2026 appeared first on AdExchanger.

value.content:

value.title: 2025: The Year Google Lost In Court And Won Anyway
value.content:
From afar, it looks like Google had a rough year. It was found guilty of operating an illegal search monopoly and a publisher ad tech monopoly, not to mention getting hit with a raft of civil antitrust suits brought by ad tech But zoom in a bit and it becomes clear that the past year […]
